column4: My program 'Gnome System Monitor' lists for my / partition: "free 4,3 GB, available 3,7 GB." What is the difference between 'free' and 'available'?
the amount of physical drive left vs the amount of addressable drive left.
Why is not all of physical memory addressable?
because each sector uses 4kb of data i believe, not 1kb, and you can't use a fraction of a sector.
